intro: Hibiscus ovatus, commonly known as the oval hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy, ovate-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with broad, heart-shaped leaves. Hibiscus ovatus thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its flowers bloom throughout the growing season, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
